1399773621564887045.text: The survivors of the Tulsa-Greenwood Massacre, some of whom are still alive, are a prime example of wisdom and inspiration. I am so grateful to them, and to all people who are making sure we don't forget our history.

1399773620180750340.text: Our history must not be swept under the rug for other people's comfort. America needs to know our whole story -- one of pain and injustice, but also of hope and resiliency.

1399773618645745664.text: Unfortunately, as tragic and destructive as this massacre was, many people are just learning about it today. For centuries, many of the events that make up the Black experience in America have been deliberately suppressed and whitewashed.

1399773616477245441.text: This week marks the 100th anniversary of the Tulsa-Greenwood Massacre. This area was once called Black Wall Street because the community was so prosperous. 1365092588064288768.text: When the lowest wage workers do better, everyone does better. Raising the minimum wage will help economies grow and communities flourish. Don't tell me we can't afford to raise the minimum wage. We can't afford NOT to.

1365092587028234240.text: An increase in the minimum wage would also be incredibly beneficial to Black and Brown workers, who often feel the greatest brunt of our nation's growing inequality. Raising the minimum wage is a social justice issue.

1365092585300250625.text: The current pandemic has further revealed how so many of these workers are just one missed paycheck away from financial ruin. An increase in the minimum wage to $15 an hour would give 27 million workers a raise, and help them become more financially secure.

1365092582833987590.text: We need to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour. The federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25 for over a decade, and more and more Americans are living paycheck to paycheck largely because of this.
